Description: Fragment of a marl pottery jar with painted decoration preserving part of the roll rim, one triangular, pierced lug handle and upper shoulder. Exterior decorated in red-purple paint with 4 wavy lines around the rim and a festoon of 6 wavy lines, below which are remnants of what may be the upper part of a boat cabin.
Curator's comments: Marked 1654 in ink on interior. Decorated ware of Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
